edu.ucdavis.cstars.client

Class MapWidget

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucdavis.cstars.client.MapWidget

  • public class MapWidget
extends java.lang.Object
    Basic Map class with all the navigation functionalities. The Map.onLoad event is fired after the first layer has been added to the map. At this point, the map is fully functional. A Map.onLoad handler function should be used to add content and change map behaviors.
    Author:
    Justin Merz

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapWidget

        public MapWidget(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.SimplePanel mapPanel,
         MapLoadHandler onLoad)
        Creates a new map.
        Parameters:
        initializationLayer - - Layer map will be initialized to. After the map is added to the dom, this will be the first layer added to the map. Once the map is initialized the onLoad handler will be called. Can be null.
        onLoad - - This is the map load handler to be fired once the map as been added to the dom and the first layer has been initialized. Can be null.

      • MapWidget

        public MapWidget(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.SimplePanel mapPanel,
         MapLoadHandler onLoad,
         MapWidget.Options options)
        Creates a new Map.
        Parameters:
        initializationLayer - - Layer map will be initialized to. After the map is added to the dom, this will be the first layer added to the map. Once the map is initialized the onLoad handler will be called.
        onLoad - - This is the map load handler to be fired once the map as been added to the dom and the first layer has been initialized. Can be null.
        options - - Optional parameters for the map.

    • Method Detail

      • addControl

        public void addControl(Control control)
        Add new control to the Control Layer. The control layer is not apart of the ESRI library, rather an added component in the GWT library.
        Parameters:
        control - - Control to be added to the map

      • removeControl

        public void removeControl(Control control)
        Remove control from the Control Layer. The control layer is not apart of the ESRI library, rather an added component in the GWT library.
        Parameters:
        control - - Control to be removed

      • assertLoaded

        public static final boolean assertLoaded()
        Make sure the $wnd.esri library has been loaded. Alert error message and return false if it has not been loaded. Othewise return true.
        Returns:
        boolean

        Returns:

      • getMapPanel

        public com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.SimplePanel getMapPanel()

      • setSize

        public void setSize(java.lang.String width,
           java.lang.String height)
        Updates the MapWidget's size. If the map has been loaded, resize() will be called automatically. If the map hasn't loaded (attached to the DOM with at least one layer loaded) you need to call resize() once the map is loaded or bad things will happen. You can add an event listener to onMapLoad to know when the map is loaded.
        Parameters:
        width - - width MapWidget should be set to
        height - - height MapWidget should be set to

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(java.lang.String width)
        Updates the MapWidget's width. If the map has been loaded, resize() will be called automatically. If the map hasn't loaded (attached to the DOM with at least one layer loaded) you need to call resize() once the map is loaded or bad things will happen. You can add an event listener to onMapLoad to know when the map is loaded.
        Parameters:
        width - - width MapWidget should be set to

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight(java.lang.String height)
        Updates the MapWidget's height. If the map has been loaded, resize() will be called automatically. If the map hasn't loaded (attached to the DOM with at least one layer loaded) you need to call resize() once the map is loaded or bad things will happen. You can add an event listener to onMapLoad to know when the map is loaded.
        Parameters:
        height - - height MapWidget should be set to

      • isFadeOnZoom

        public boolean isFadeOnZoom()
        Indicates if the fade effect is enabled while zooming. Only applicable when navigationMode is set to 'css-transforms'.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • isForce3DTransforms

        public boolean isForce3DTransforms()
        When the mapNavigation mode is set to 'css-transforms', CSS3 transforms will be used for map navigation when supported by the browser. It is recommended that you let the map determine when to enable transformations to avoid running into a known issue with scrollbar rendering on Chrome on Windows XP.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • isRubberBandZoom

        public boolean isRubberBandZoom()
        When true, rubberband zoom is enabled. This allows users to draw a bounding box zoom area using the mouse.

      • isScrollWheelZoom

        public boolean isScrollWheelZoom()
        When true, the mouse scroll wheel zoom is enabled.

      • isShiftDoubleClickZoom

        public boolean isShiftDoubleClickZoom()

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded()
        After the first layer is loaded, the value is set to true.
        Returns:

      • getNavigationMode

        public java.lang.String getNavigationMode()
        Indicates whether the map uses CSS3 transformations when panning and zooming. In 'css-transform' mode the map will use CSS3 transformations, if supported by the browser, to provide a smoother experience while panning and zooming the map.
        Returns:
        String

      • getPosition

        public Point getPosition()
        This point geometry in screen coordinates represent the top-left corner of the map container. This coordinate also acts as the origin for all screen coordinates returned by Map and GraphicsLayer events.
        Returns:
        Point

      • getRoot

        public com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element getRoot()
        The DOM node that contains the container of layers, build-in info window, logo and slider. (As of v2.2)
        Returns:
        Element

      • getSnappingManager

        public SnappingManager getSnappingManager()
        If snapping is enabled on the map using map.enableSnapping() this property provides access to the SnappingManager. The snapping manager's setLayerInfo method can be used to modify the target snapping layers.
        Returns:
        SnappingManager

      • addLayer

        public Layer addLayer(Layer layer,
             int index)
        Adds an ESRI Layer to the map.
        Parameters:
        layer - - Layer to be added to the map.
        index - - A layer can be added at a specific index in the map.

      • addLayer

        public Layer addLayer(Layer layer)
        Adds an ESRI Layer to the map.
        Parameters:
        layer - - Layer to be added to the map.

      • addLayers

        public void addLayers(Layer[] layers)
        Adds multiple layers to a map. The array order corresponds to the layer order in the client side map. The onLayerAddResult event fires for each layer that is added. Once all the layers are added to the map the onLayersAddResult fires.
        Parameters:
        layers - - Layers to be added to the map.

      • centerAndZoom

        public void centerAndZoom(Point center,
                 double levelOrFactor)
        Centers and zooms the map.
        Parameters:
        center - - Centers the map on the specified x,y location.
        levelOrFactor - - When using an ArcGISTiledMapServiceLayer, the map is zoomed to the level specified. When using a DynamicMapServiceLayer, the map is zoomed in or out by the specified factor. For example, use 0.5 to zoom in twice as far and 2.0 to zoom out twice as far.

      • centerAt

        public void centerAt(Point center)
        Recenters the map based on map coordinates as the center point.
        Parameters:
        center - - Centers the map on the specified x,y location.

      • enableSnapping

        public SnappingManager enableSnapping()
        Enable snapping on the map when working with the Editor, Measurement widget or the Draw and Edit toolbars. All graphics layers, including feature layers, will be set as snap targets. Call this method after the layers are loaded.
        Returns:
        SnappingManager

      • enableSnapping

        public SnappingManager enableSnapping(SnappingManager.SnappingOptions options)
        Enable snapping on the map when working with the Editor, Measurement widget or the Draw and Edit toolbars. Call this method after the layers are loaded.
        Parameters:
        options - - optional parameters
        Returns:
        SnappingManager

      • removeAllLayers

        public void removeAllLayers()
        Removes all layers from the map. The map's extent, spatial reference, and tiling scheme if defined do not change when the layers are removed. When the next layer is added to the map, this layer is displayed at the same extent and spatial reference.

      • removeLayer

        public void removeLayer(Layer layer)
        Removes the specified layer from the map.
        Parameters:
        layer - - Layer to be removed from the map.

      • reorderLayer

        public void reorderLayer(Layer layer,
                int index)
        Changes the layer order in the map.
        Parameters:
        layer - - The layer to be moved.
        index - - Refers to the location for placing the layer. The bottom most layer has an index of 0.

      • reposition

        public void reposition()
        Repositions the map DIV on the page. This method should be used after the map DIV has been repostioned.

      • resize

        public void resize()
        Resizes the map DIV. This method should be used after the map DIV has been resized.

      • setExtent

        public void setExtent(Extent extent,
             boolean fit)
        Sets the extent of the map. The extent must be in the same spatial reference as the map.
        Parameters:
        extent - - Sets the minx, miny, maxx, and maxy for a map.
        fit - - When true, for maps that contain tiled map service layers, you are guaranteed to have the input extent shown completely on the map.

      • setExtent

        public void setExtent(Extent extent)
        Sets the extent of the map. The extent must be in the same spatial reference as the map.
        Parameters:
        extent - - Sets the minx, miny, maxx, and maxy for a map.

      • setLevel

        public void setLevel(int level)
        Sets the map to the specified level ID. Zooms to the new level based on the current map center point. Valid only with an ArcGISTiledMapService layer.
        Parameters:
        level - - The level ID.

      • setMapCursor

        public void setMapCursor(java.lang.String cursor)
        Sets the default cursor for the map. This cursor is shown whenever the mouse is pointed over the map, except when panning by dragging the map or using SHIFT+Drag to zoom. If not set, the map uses the platform-dependent default cursor, usually an arrow.
        Parameters:
        cursor - - A standard CSS cursor value. Some common values include "default", "pointer", "crosshair", "text", "help", and "wait".

      • setTimeExtent

        public void setTimeExtent(TimeExtent timeExtent)
        Sets the TimeExtent for the map. When the time extent is changed the onTimeExtentChange event fires. Time aware layers listen for this event and update to only display content for the current time extent.
        Parameters:
        timeExtent - - Set the time extent for which data is displayed on the map.

      • setTimeSlider

        public void setTimeSlider(TimeSlider timeSlider)
        Set the time slider associated with the map.
        Parameters:
        timeSlider - - The time slider dijit to associate with the map.

      • showPanArrows

        public void showPanArrows()
        Shows the pan arrows on the map.

      • showZoomSlider

        public void showZoomSlider()
        Shows the zoom slider on the map.

      • toMap

        public final Point toMap(Point screenPoint)
        Converts a single screen point or an array of screen points to map coordinates.
        Parameters:
        screenPoint - - Converts screen coordinates to map coordinates.
        Returns:
        Point

      • toScreen

        public final Point toScreen(Point mapPoint)
        Converts a single map point or an array of map points to screen coordinates.
        Parameters:
        mapPoint - - Converts map coordinates to screen coordinates.
        Returns:
        Point

      • addMouseDownHandler

        public void addMouseDownHandler(MouseDownHandler handler)
        Parameters:
        handler - - Fires when a mouse button is pressed down and the mouse cursor is in the map region of the HTML page.

      • addMouseDragHandler

        public void addMouseDragHandler(MapMouseDragHandler handler)
        Parameters:
        handler - - Fires while the mouse is being dragged until the mouse button is released.

      • addMouseDragEndHandler

        public void addMouseDragEndHandler(MapMouseDragEndHandler handler)
        Parameters:
        handler - - Fires when a mouse button is released and the user stops dragging the mouse.

      • addMouseDragStartHandler

        public void addMouseDragStartHandler(MapMouseDragStartHandler handler)
        Parameters:
        handler - - Fires when a mouse button is pressed down and the user starts to drag the mouse.

      • addMouseMoveHandler

        public void addMouseMoveHandler(MouseMoveHandler handler)
        Parameters:
        handler - - Fires any time the mouse pointer moves over the map region. A common use for this event is to show the current x,y coordinate of the map as the user moves the mouse pointer.

      • addMouseOutHandler

        public void addMouseOutHandler(MouseOutHandler handler)
        Parameters:
        handler - - Fires when the mouse moves out of the map region of the HTML page.

      • addMouseOverHandler

        public void addMouseOverHandler(MouseOverHandler handler)
        Parameters:
        handler - - Fires when the mouse moves into the map region of the HTML page.

      • addMouseUpHandler

        public void addMouseUpHandler(MouseUpHandler handler)
        Parameters:
        handler - - Fires when the mouse button is released and the mouse pointer is within the map region of the HTML page.

        handler - - Fires when the mouse wheel is scrolled.

        Parameters:
        handler - - Fires during the zoom process.

      • addUpdateEndHandler

        public void addUpdateEndHandler(UpdateEndHandler handler)
        Parameters:
        handler - - Fires after layers that are updating their content have completed. This event is often used in combination with onUpdateStart to display a "Map is busy" or "Loading? " message as visual feedback to the end-user. (As of v2.2)

      • addUpdateStartHandler

        public void addUpdateStartHandler(UpdateStartHandler handler)
        Parameters:
        handler - - Fires when one or more layers being updating their content. This event is often used in combination with onUpdateEnd to display a "Map is busy" or "Loading? " message as visual feedback to the end-user. (As of v2.2)

      • addZoomEndHandler

        public void addZoomEndHandler(MapZoomEndHandler handler)
        Parameters:
        handler - - Fires when the zoom is complete.

      • addZoomStartHandler

        public void addZoomStartHandler(MapZoomStartHandler handler)
        Parameters:
        handler - - Fires when a user commences zooming.
